description: Japan's astronomical encoding spans three interwoven layers: Shinto (the Way of the Gods — shrine alignments, solar and lunar deities), Onmyōdō (the Way of Yin-Yang — esoteric cosmology mapping five elements to planets), and Buddhist-Taoist star worship (Myōken Bosatsu / Pole Star veneration). The 20-year rebuilding cycle of Ise Grand Shrine mirrors the Jupiter-Saturn conjunction. The Seven Lucky Gods map to the seven visible celestial bodies. Mount Fuji's geometry encodes the same sacred angles found in every pyramid and stone circle on Earth. Same sky, same pattern — different language.
source_tradition: Shinto / Onmyōdō / Mikkyō / Japanese Imperial Court astronomy, Japan (660 BCE legendary founding — present), inheriting Chinese astronomical frameworks reinterpreted through indigenous Shinto cosmology

symbols.name: Amaterasu (天照大御神)
symbols.meaning: Great Goddess who Illuminates Heaven — the Sun itself
symbols.astronomical_identity: Amaterasu IS the Sun. When she hid in the cave (Ama-no-Iwato), the world went dark — a solar eclipse. Sun-Jupiter trine = she emerges, light returns, expansion.

symbols.name: Tsukuyomi (月読命)
symbols.meaning: Moon Reader — the god who counts the months
symbols.astronomical_identity: Tsukuyomi IS the Moon. Born from Izanagi's right eye (Amaterasu from the left). Moon-Neptune trine = intuitive flow, the unseen tide.

symbols.name: Susanoo (須佐之男命)
symbols.meaning: The Tempest — storm god, slayer of the eight-headed serpent
symbols.astronomical_identity: Susanoo's rage = Mars-Uranus conjunction. Sudden violent disruption that ultimately saves (he killed Yamata-no-Orochi and found the Kusanagi sword inside).

symbols.name: Izanagi & Izanami (伊邪那岐・伊邪那美)
symbols.meaning: He Who Invites & She Who Invites — the creation pair who stirred the cosmic ocean
symbols.astronomical_identity: The primal duality — Sun-Moon opposition. They stand on the Floating Bridge of Heaven (the ecliptic) and stir the ocean below with the Jeweled Spear (the Earth's axis).

symbols.name: Inari Ōkami (稲荷大神)
symbols.meaning: God of foxes, rice, fertility, prosperity — the most worshipped kami in Japan (32,000 shrines)
symbols.astronomical_identity: Inari = prosperity through abundance. Venus-Jupiter conjunction = maximum financial blessing, the fox spirit of wealth.

symbols.name: Raijin & Fūjin (雷神・風神)
symbols.meaning: Thunder God & Wind God — the guardians at every temple gate
symbols.astronomical_identity: Jupiter (thunder) square to Uranus (sudden wind) = the volatile gate. Great energy but dangerous to cross unprepared.

symbols.name: Benzaiten (弁財天)
symbols.meaning: Goddess of everything that flows — water, music, eloquence, wealth
symbols.astronomical_identity: Venus in her flowing form — Venus-Neptune sextile, beauty dissolving into the cosmic ocean of abundance.

symbols.name: Daikokuten (大黒天)
symbols.meaning: God of great darkness and great wealth — stands on rice bales with magic mallet
symbols.astronomical_identity: Saturn (great darkness, structure) trine Jupiter (abundance) = patient wealth through discipline. He carries the mallet of fulfillment.

symbols.name: Ebisu (恵比寿)
symbols.meaning: God of fishermen, merchants, honest labour — the only purely Japanese of the Seven Lucky Gods
symbols.astronomical_identity: Mercury (commerce) sextile Moon (tides, fishing) = honest trade follows natural rhythms. Ebisu always carries a sea bream (tai = auspicious).

symbols.name: Bishamonten (毘沙門天)
symbols.meaning: God of warriors and protectors — guardian of the North, treasure pagoda in hand
symbols.astronomical_identity: Mars (warrior) trine Saturn (fortress) = disciplined defense that protects wealth. He guards the treasure pagoda.

symbols.name: Ise Grand Shrine (伊勢神宮)
symbols.meaning: Most sacred Shinto shrine — rebuilt every 20 years (Shikinen Sengū) since 690 CE
symbols.builder_tradition: Imperial Shinto (continuous since 4 BCE legendary, 690 CE documented)
symbols.astronomical_identity: The 20-year rebuilding cycle = Jupiter-Saturn conjunction cycle (19.86 years). Every renewal happens when the two great planets meet. This is the same cycle Stonehenge and Göbekli Tepe tracked.

symbols.name: Mount Fuji (富士山)
symbols.meaning: Sacred mountain — 3,776m, visible from Tokyo, pilgrimage peak, the axis mundi of Japan
symbols.builder_tradition: Natural formation venerated since prehistoric Jōmon period
symbols.astronomical_identity: The perfect cone = the connection between Earth and Heaven. Sun-Saturn trine = structured, patient ascent to the summit. Fuji's slope angle (approximately 35°) relates to the co-latitude of the sacred sites band.

symbols.name: Izumo Taisha (出雲大社)
symbols.meaning: Grand Shrine of Izumo — second holiest shrine, where all gods gather in October (Kamiarizuki)
symbols.astronomical_identity: All 8 million kami gather here in October = the great conjunction. Jupiter-Venus trine = when gods of expansion and beauty meet, all blessings converge.

symbols.name: Kumano Sanzan (熊野三山)
symbols.meaning: Three Grand Shrines of Kumano — the most important pilgrimage in Japan, walked by emperors and peasants alike
symbols.builder_tradition: Pre-Shinto mountain worship (sangaku shinkō), formalized 10th century CE
symbols.astronomical_identity: Three shrines = three points of a trine. The pilgrimage path itself traces the 120° angle across the mountains. Sun-Neptune sextile = spiritual illumination through dedicated journey.

symbols.name: Moku (木) — Wood Phase
symbols.meaning: Growth, spring, expansion, the liver, the dragon, the colour green
symbols.astronomical_identity: Wood = Jupiter. Growth phase. Jupiter-Sun sextile = controlled expansion, the sapling reaching toward light.

symbols.name: Ka (火) — Fire Phase
symbols.meaning: Transformation, summer, passion, the heart, the phoenix, the colour red
symbols.astronomical_identity: Fire = Mars. Transformation phase. Mars-Sun conjunction = maximum solar fire, the peak of yang energy.

symbols.name: Do (土) — Earth Phase
symbols.meaning: Stability, centre, harvest, the spleen, the yellow dragon, balance between all phases
symbols.astronomical_identity: Earth = Saturn. Centre/stability phase. Saturn-Venus sextile = beauty grounded in structure, the golden mean.

symbols.name: Gon/Kin (金) — Metal Phase
symbols.meaning: Contraction, autumn, grief, the lungs, the white tiger, the colour white
symbols.astronomical_identity: Metal = Venus (gold/copper). Contraction phase. Venus-Saturn square = beauty tested by restriction, refinement through pressure.

symbols.name: Sui (水) — Water Phase
symbols.meaning: Dissolution, winter, fear, the kidneys, the black tortoise, the colour black
symbols.astronomical_identity: Water = Mercury (flow). Dissolution phase. Mercury-Neptune conjunction = communication dissolves into the unconscious, deep introspection.

symbols.name: Myōken Bosatsu (妙見菩薩)
symbols.meaning: Bodhisattva of the Pole Star — the unmoved mover, the axis around which all stars rotate
symbols.astronomical_identity: The Pole Star doesn't move — everything else orbits around it. Saturn-Pluto trine = deepest structural transformation around an immovable truth.

symbols.name: Tanabata (七夕)
symbols.meaning: Star Festival — Orihime (Vega) and Hikoboshi (Altair) meet across the Milky Way once per year on July 7th
symbols.astronomical_identity: The lovers separated by the Milky Way meet at Venus-Mars opposition = the magnetic attraction of opposites across the greatest distance.

symbols.name: Setsubun (節分)
symbols.meaning: Division of Seasons — throwing beans to drive out oni (demons), the day before spring
symbols.astronomical_identity: The exact cross-quarter day between winter solstice and spring equinox. Sun-Mars sextile = energized purification, driving out stagnation.

symbols.name: Torii Gate (鳥居)
symbols.meaning: The sacred gate — threshold between profane and sacred, found at every shrine entrance
symbols.astronomical_identity: The torii is a portal — the exact moment of transition. Mercury-Uranus sextile = the flash of insight when crossing between worlds.

symbols.name: Shimenawa (注連縄)
symbols.meaning: Sacred rope — marks the boundary of sacred space, twisted from rice straw
symbols.astronomical_identity: The twisted rope encodes the double helix — Moon-Saturn sextile = disciplined boundary, the sacred container that holds cosmic energy safely.

symbols.name: Magatama (勾玉)
symbols.meaning: Curved jewel — one of the Three Imperial Regalia, the comma-shaped bead, yin-yang in stone
symbols.deity: Part of the Imperial Regalia (Yasakani no Magatama)
symbols.astronomical_identity: The magatama IS a yin-yang diagram in 3D — the spiral that contains both polarities. Venus-Moon quintile (72°) = the golden spiral of beauty and intuition.

symbols.name: Kusanagi no Tsurugi (草薙剣)
symbols.meaning: Grass-Cutting Sword — found inside Yamata-no-Orochi by Susanoo, one of the Three Imperial Regalia
symbols.deity: Part of the Imperial Regalia, kept at Atsuta Shrine
symbols.astronomical_identity: The sword found inside the chaos serpent = Mars-Pluto trine. The warrior who descends into death and emerges with the weapon of truth.

symbols.name: Yata no Kagami (八咫鏡)
symbols.meaning: Eight-Span Mirror — used to lure Amaterasu from her cave, one of the Three Imperial Regalia
symbols.deity: Part of the Imperial Regalia, kept at Ise Grand Shrine inner sanctum
symbols.astronomical_identity: The mirror that reflects the Sun goddess back to herself = Sun-Venus sextile, self-awareness through beauty, truth reflected.

symbols.name: Ensō (円相)
symbols.meaning: The Zen circle — drawn in a single brushstroke, represents enlightenment, the universe, the void
symbols.astronomical_identity: The perfect circle = the complete orbit. Neptune-Pluto sextile = the longest planetary cycle visible (492 years), the great wheel that turns behind all smaller wheels.
